resources.string: Please allow permissions before using this app
No fingerprint sensor was detected on this device
This service allows for gesture navigation using the fingerprint sensor.
Enables navigation controls using swipe gestures on the fingerprint sensor
Swipe Up - Recent Apps Overview\nSwipe Down - Home\nSwipe Left - Back
Changes the function of swipe gestures when \"Recent Apps\" are being shown
Swipe Down - Select app\nSwipe Left - scroll to the left\nSwipe Right - scroll to the right
Report the bug you observed here. Please be as descriptive as possible, including your phone model and android version.
There was an issue sending your feedback. Please try again
What type of feedback would you like to give?
While in the recent tasks view, swiping up and down on the fingerprint censor will cycle through the recent tasks. Swiping right will select the highlighted task.

Accessibility services need access to potentially sensitive system features. For example, this app must monitor gesture input from the fingerprint sensor and determine which app is in the foreground. This allows fingerprint gesture commands and navigation to work properly. This does not allow the application to record any personal information (nor does this app do that for any reason).
This service must be enabled in Accessibility Settings before you can use it.
Accessibility service has not been activated.
Enable Close App on Swipe Up
Swiping up while in the recent tasks view will now remove the selected app instead of performing the specified action.
